inst/question: Jerome had 4 friends who came to visit him on a certain day. The first friend pressed on the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened, the second friend pressed on the doorbell 1/4 times more than Jerome's first friend. The third friend pressed on the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend pressed on the doorbell 60 times, how many doorbell rings did the doorbell make?
reason/cot:
The first friend pressed on the doorbell 20 times.
The second friend pressed on the doorbell 1/4 times more than the first friend, so the second friend pressed on the doorbell 20 x 1/4 = 5 times more than the first friend.
The third friend pressed on the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend, so the third friend pressed on the doorbell 60 times more than the fourth friend.
The fourth friend pressed on the doorbell 60 times more than the fourth friend.
The total number of doorbell rings made by the fourth friend is 60 times more than the fourth friend.
The answer is 60 times more than the fourth friend.
